Reviews.Title: “wonderful 2nd stay at the RAST”
Reviews.Author: FrMetrie
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, helpful and friendly staff. Our 2nd stay there and probably not the last one. Really enjoyed the stay. Wonderful rooftop breakfast room with a wide choice. Thanks to the whole staff for helping me practise my Turkish with special thanks to smiling Sevgi and the breakfast room team.!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit of Rast”
Reviews.Author: SamiRaleigh_NC
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to Rast Hotel in 8 months. I stayed this time 8 nights in a triple with my family. They renovated the roof top and setting and view was excellent. Breakfast was a generous buffet with eggs, yogurt, cheeses, juice, pastries, bread, fruit, etc. The triple room had plenty of space, was very clean, and the wireless worked great. The pickup from the airport went smoothly although I had to call them when I got there. The lobby was immaculate but the best part of the hotel is its location. It is a 5 minute walk to the bazaar, 3 minute walk to the tram station, and 5minute walk to the Blue Mosque. The staff, especially, Sevgi, Fatih, and Mustafa were very attentive and always smiling and playing with kids. I have stayed at other places in Istanbul but you cannot beat the location and service that the Rast offers. Of note, in Sultanahmet area all the hotels are boutique hotels so other amenities are limited.

Reviews.Title: “Rast Hotel - short trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RuiSanchez
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in the age of 27 and decided very spontaneously to travel to Istanbul. After checking a few hotels in the city center via the internet, we chose the Rast Hotel. At first we booked only one night, for which we payed about 60 â‚¬per person / per night including the breakfast. Because of a bid delay with the plane we wrote an email to the hotel (directly before the take off) that we'll arrive late in the evening and we further asked if it's possible to arrange a transfer from the airport to the hotel. One hotel manager from the service team immediately replied, that everything is arranged. After the arrival in Istanbul a taxi driver was already searching for us and drove us quickly to the hotel, where the staff welcomed us warmly. The rooms are not very big but sufficient and clean. Further our room (4th floor) offerd a lovely view to the mosque and free wi-fi. Anyway the location of the hotel is wonderful. It's very close to all the most important places and attractions of the city, so that it's possbile tto reach all places by walking in 5 minutes (blue mosque, hagia sophia, grand bazaar, etc) or 20 minutes (galata bridge, spice bazaar, palace, etc) up to 30 minutes (galata tower). The breakfast is small but nice and the staff is very helpful and welcoming. The view from the terrace is simply wonderful and impressive - a very good place to enjoy a cappuccino or tea and some sweets. According to all our first impressions we decided to stay all of our 'Istanbul nights' in the Rast Hotel and extended our booking for the same price. In reference to this, the hotel gave us one transfer to the airport for free. All in all we enjoyed Istanbul and the hotel very much. Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “we just loved Rast Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Furcyte
Reviews.Content: We stayed in triple room for 3 nights - and enjoyed every minute.. everything was first class- from very welcoming reception guy to oustanding breakfast with one million dollar view to Bosphorus and Blue Mosque... We came by car and parked it safely by the entrance of hotel. Highly recommended

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Fairy Meadow, New South Wales, Australia
Reviews.Title: “Excellent service,location and very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sema A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Rast hotel with my daughter in march. It was great 5 days. Location was excellent. It's close all amenities; grand baazar,Sultan Ahmet mosque,Blue mosque,Sarnic, Taksim,tramway. Everything is just walking distance. Breakfast is delicious and mouth watering. Staff's always helpfull and kind. thank's to all staff,specialy mustafa bey,serkan bey,mesut bey and sevgi hnm,for great service.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELCHICK48
Reviews.Content: The absolute best thing about this hotel is the location, just minutes from Sultanahmet Square, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Topkapi Palace. The hotel was ok, cannot see that it could be described as 'boutique' more baroque. Staff were very welcoming and seemed keen to please. Room (405) was small, bathroom smaller still as it had been shoe horned into the corner of the room. Bed was exceedingly hard and pillows lumpy. Despite a request for the AC to be switched on the room was uncomfortably hot at night necessitating the us to leave the balcolny door open with consequent street noise and audible calling to prayers. Needless to say not much sleep. Breakfasts were a selection of usual hot and cold, nothing especially well or badly done. Sunday breakfast was ruined with the arrival of 30 or so male day guests. Despite a long table being set up on the terrace for them they used just about every inside table, swept through the buffet like a plague of locusts and then were waited on hand and foot whilst all the other resident guests had to wait for further supplies to be brought up from the kitchen. One couple did not even have a table to sit at and perched on a banquette with a low table to eat their breakfast. We like another couple of guests had to vacate before supplies were replenished as we were being collected for an escorted trip. To add insult to injury having been summonsed to reception we didn't leave for another half hour by which time most of the day guests had dispersed. The hotel is not bad, but could do with a bit of updating. Have to say the one thing I think they should make a bit more effort with is the upstairs terrace overlooking the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. The views are tremendous, but there is nothing to keep you up there, the cafe is completely inadequate, a request for 2 diet cokes took ten minutes and then a further ten minutes to get some ice. We only discovered they had a restaurant by accident, but was disappointed to discover it only served fish. Genuinely feel they are missing out as so much more could be achieved with this asset, all the bars and restaurants in the area had outside heating comfy seating and ambient lighting. If they want to attract a younger livelier crowd they need to think about providing a bar and a bit of life.

Reviews.Title: “best view in turkey”
Reviews.Author: 346jeff
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have just returned from a short stay at the hotel RAST in Sultanamet, Istanbul.First impressions Delightful boutique style hotel with lovely views of the blue mosque and surrounding areas.Stayed on bed and breakfast basis and there was enough choice to keep everyone happy. Room was on the small side but the view made up for it, and we were not in room long enough to notice. Staff were very polite and knowledgeable of areas to be visited.Checked up on trip trip advisor day before travel to see best way to get to hotel from airport, we were qouted 40 euros each way so heres my tip!!!!! once through customs follow signs for the metro, take train for 6 stops get off and then take tram to sultanamet 12 stops ,tram stops 100 mtrs from hotel walk back towards mcdonalds and ist turning left ,hotel is on the right hand side COST 2 euros each about Â£1. 60.We would definitly use this hotel again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Linda G
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived Mesut Erdogan (Happy) and other front desk staff took great care of us. Our 9 day vacation to Turkey was somewhat last minute and we were not quite sure of how we would fill the time. Mesut gave us great advise on what to do in Istanbul and helped arrange travel to other parts of Turkey. All of his suggestions turned out better than we could have hoped. On the first day he arranged for a very knowledgeable and personable guide to take us to the nearby sites of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. What a great introduction to the city that was! Mesut also set us up with Huseyin Yayla at Walkabout Travel who quickly arranged a wonderful 5 day trip to Epheses and Cappadocia. The hotel rooms we had were comfortable, attractive and clean with lovely views. The breakfast room on the 6th floor itself had amazing views of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Bosphorus and more. A breathtaking way to start your day!

Reviews.Title: “couldnt ask for a better location, and staff.”
Reviews.Author: alex i
Reviews.Content: my fiance and i stayed in the rast hotel at the end of january, the hotel was great it truely is in the centre of it all, all the main attractions are within a genuine 2-5 minute walk, the staff especially MR Happy, who recommended some amazing resturants and places to see, the room and breakfast was of a good standard but the views from the hotel resturant were totally breath taking

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes!”
Reviews.Author: Nigelcaptain
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, clean and comfortable with everything you need for a weekend to take in the sights of the city. Staff were helpful, and I would mention 'Sevgi' who looked after us very well for breakfast and service. Always smiling and taking great of you , thanks Sevgi, hope to see you again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, reasonable priced, great location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: danielprague
Reviews.Content: would definitely stay there again, the rooftop restaurant and breakfast area (and good reviews here) made me book the place and i had no regrets.. could not get enough of the amazing views..

Reviews.Title: “Warm Anatolian welcome”
Reviews.Author: timetachyon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a week in the heart of Istanbul in the Sultanahmet district in the boutique hotel - The RAST Hotel. We had an excellent experience there being just 8 mins walk from the Blue Mosque, 10 mins walk Aya Sofra and 12 mins walk Topkapi Palace. The views from the top floor where we had breakfast every morning were stunning. The room we had was small but adequate and we had very good sleep every night. We both enjoyed the breakfasts and the excellent attention provided by staff expecially one very pleasant lady Sevgi. The staff on reception were always helpful and there are two computers for use by guests. I would recommend using this hotel. My only criticism would be the difficulty in regulating the temperature of the room which could be too hot sometimes. You are just 12 mins from the Grand Bazaar or 18 mins walk to the Spice Market. We enjoyed every evening the trip down the road (3 mins) to our favourite pub The Cozy Pub!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel well placed”
Reviews.Author: Blimey0Reilly
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the TripAdvisor ratings. It is a nice hotel and very well positioned but we didn't find it quite as good as other reviewers. The hotel staff were helpful if you asked for anything but when the restaurant was out of commission due to redecoration, we we told that we would have to wait for a few hours to get tea or coffee. It would have been good for them to put facilities in the lovely lounges or to offer free tea and coffee in the rooms. Our room was clean but the beds were very firm and the air conditioning kept reverting to 30C no matter how hard we tried so we had to use the balcony door as our aircon! The bathroom was small but adequate although the step into and out of the bath/shower is quite high if you have any knee or hip problems. Having said all of that, this hotel is superbly positioned for the tourist attractions and the tram stop is very nearby. The view from the dining room is wonderful and we enjoyed our stay there. Our son particularly enjoyed the massage chairs in the lobby! It is definitely worth booking a taxi or minibus to and from the airport as it is a good way away and would have been difficult to find it by ourselves to begin with.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; great location; great staff! B and W”
Reviews.Author: Barbara P
Reviews.Content: The Rast Hotel was recommended to us by a resident of Istanbul as a great location to easily visiting many historical sights.We also read reviews here an felt confident that we had made a great choice for our stay in Istanbul. We were not disappoined. The location is as promised incredible; an easy walk from many tourist attractions as well as access to the tram stop; restaurants; shops etc.The room was clean and neat. We had a nephew come to stay for a few nights and there was plenty of room to add a cot. Staff at the front desk were some of the best I have experienced. They were always pleasant and professional and willing to go that extra mile for the guests. The complementary breakfast encompassed a nice variety of dishes presented beautifully. The staff were exceptional. Renovations were being carried out on the rooftop terrace during our stay but every morning Sevgi met us with a big smile and a pleasant greeting. She and Fatih both provided personnel service and attention above and beyond any I have experienced. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone for its location; services; convenience; and professional; friendly and helpful staff. This is a great hotel with a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great views!”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteDewsnap
Reviews.Content: I booked the Rast Hotel as part of a package deal with BA and decided on this hotel because of the reviews on here. We were not disappointed. The location was fantastic, 5 minutes from the tourist attractions in Sultanahmet. The reception staff were brilliant - on arrival they gave us complimentary drinks and gave us an orienteering session which was very useful. The room we had was very comfortable, not massive but exactly what we needed. The bed was very comfy and we couldn't fault it. The breakfast was a buffet and there were plenty of delicious things to eat. We loved our stay in Istanbul - despite the heavy snowfall on the Friday - it made it all the more memorable! And I would highly recommend staying at the Rast Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable, good value and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: aim-to-travel-light
Reviews.Content: Faced with the choice of hundreds and hundreds of hotels in Istanbul I was a little daunted. I read reviews and booked this place. I did not regret it. I was extremely impressed with the location (tram stop nearby and masses to do in walking distance), the view from the breakfast room (see photos on website), the choice of food at breakfast, the comfort of the room (although a quite small twin room with small bathroom it was certainly more than adequate - and clean and smart) and the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff. I would recommend it and that is not something I say lightly about a hotel. If three or more nights booked there is a free airport pick-up service. It worked well. Due to the inefficiency of the airport (passport control is a nightmare) the driver had to wait over an hour for us but was still cheerful and friendly. It was good not having to worry about finding the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rast hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: salywy08
Reviews.Content: It was an amazing experience. The hotel was very clean. The staff were wonderful specially ' Happy" The hotel wasclose to everything. you could basically walk to the blue mosque, museums, Bazar ...etc. The train was just outside the hotel. The breakfast was delicious and everyday is a new menu. The view of the sun actually rising over in between H. Sophia and the Blue Mosque was amazing!!! Thanks to everyone your staff is wonderfull. Mohamed and family from the USA ( December 20-25, 2011)

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful stay!”
Reviews.Author: lanslide03
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights at this lovely hotel. I have nothing but compliments for this hotel and its staff. We arrived and were warmly greeted by the hotel staff. We were served tea and talked about things we could do with our time in Istanbul. Great recommendations all around! The room itself is a little on the small size, but clean, comfortable, and nice decor. The six floor terrace, where we enjoyed our breakfasts, has an amazing view of the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. Everything is within walking distance from this hotel. We will be staying here again for our next trip to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Comments from Moscow.”
Reviews.Author: Lazishvili I
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rast Hotel from 29.12.-04.01.12. At the beginning we were a bit upset by not meeting us at the airport,as it was agreed before.But, in return we were provided free the car back.At the hotel we were offered a suite for one night and for the rest of our stay we had 2 separate rooms instead of reserved triple room.We were happy!Our impression is that it hotel is one of the best for this prise.The location is perfect,it is only 5 min.to the Sultanahmet square,tram's stop,the Grand Bazar is also nearby.There are a lot of shops,restaurants around.Tasty breakfast was served on the roof with a breathtaking view of the Blue Mosque and Ayasofya.The staff of the hotel is polite,supportive and helpful.We really enjoyed staying and would recommend the Rast Hotel for a holiday.We had a very good time in Istanbul and hope to make a comeback!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice. Location, view, safety and value.”
Reviews.Author: Sandranrg
Reviews.Content: Not much can be said that has not yet. What best way to start your day in Istambul than with this amazing view of the sun actually rising over in between H. Sophia and the Blue Mosque? I guess the delicious breakfast, attentive staff, cleaningness all over, quality of sleep and the free massage chairs on the lobby become secondary, right? But it is also there for any of us to enjoy. This is a fantastic place, stop looking!

Reviews.Title: “Week in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: rav t
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel from reviews on trip adviser,feel that they are accurate. Firstly location excellent, Secondly staff excellent front desk Serkan,Mesul,Ihsan,Emre were very helpful and informative. Breakfast was good and Sevgi and Fatih always greeted with smile and went an extra mile. Few problem Internet did not work at times,shower leaked in bathroom were unable to fix ,mgmt arranged another room. We liked the service a lot and requested a room on our return as well ,only to find a glitch in their reservation and the hotel was full. They arranged for a room in a hotel close by and also covered our expense for hotel transfer for the inconvenience. We highly recommend this hotel Tak's.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: marion s
Reviews.Content: While visiting Istanbul with 3 gal pals in October 2011, we stayed at the Rast Hotel and were very pleased with our choice. Location was perfect, roof top restaurant was fabulous and staff were pleasant and accommodating. Free internet and comfy chairs in the lobby added to the "convenience factor". Rooms were more than adequate with old world charm. Would highly recommend this location for anyone looking for walking distance to all the major Old Town venues.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Bibijan1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here for our vacation/honeymoon. The location was great because it was in walking distance to all the major sites. The hotel staff especially the manager was wonderful. He helped us find sites, book the sites and travels, offered suggestions, and was just really friendly and welcoming. The hotel staff especially the women in the dining room were great. They catered to whatever our needs were. I can't say enough. Our rooms were nice, neat and tidy, a bit cozy at times ( the room we got, was a little small but we weren't in there too much, so that helped). There was free internet in our rooms so that was definitely helpful. The only thing that we had a major issue with was the dining. Because it was ramazan, people would book the tables and we felt that because we were staying there as guests, guests should have the privelege of eating first and not being told that you can't eat there because it's already booked. so we pretty much ate out all the time. The breakfast and lunch were great. The view from the breakfast balcony is just great, you can't beat it. The hagia sophia and the blue mosque greet you in the morning. It was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: TheWanderingCannuck
Reviews.Content: In my view the outstanding feature of this hotel is the view of the Boshphorus, Golden Horn, and the Sultanahmet. Unimpeded views from the rooftop. I had a very small room that was nothing special. The breakfasts are great. My dinner was so so. No alcohol served here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: pmullark
Reviews.Content: My daughter-in-law and I were very pleased with the Rast Hotel. We were met as advertised at the airport upon arrival, which we appreciated. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location is so convenient to the sights and the tram. The rooms were very adequate in size, and clean. The rooftop breakfast was fabulous. My only suggestion for improvements is more lighting in the room - it was very dim. Also, we had trouble regulating the temperature in the room - it kept raising the heat setting on its own. I do recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: highimpactuk
Reviews.Content: Our vist to the Rast Hotel was on a long weekend break to Istanbul for my birthday. We wanted to stay close to the main attractions and travel around using public transport. Having searched online and taken soundings on Tripadvisor, this seemed as good as any in Sultanahmet. We were going to be using it just to sleep anyway so it was not a case of wanting too much in terms of comfort and services. The hotel itself is a relatively small (around 30+ rooms) outfit with slightly dated facades and traditional turkish furnishings. The room we got was much smaller than we expected but as previously stated, this was fine for us as it was just a few days. On arrival, we were provided with welcome tea abd biscuits and the receptionist made the effort to ensure we knew how to navigate around the city and the best ways to maximise our trip. This was a nice touch. There was free wifi and breakfast as advertised. The breakfast was just OK - nothing to write home about. There were no great expectations so we were not disappointed. Of the hot drinks tried, the hot chocolate was probably the best option and is recommended. Staff at breakfast - just like the other staff in the hotel were all very keen to please and I could not fault their service in any way. The views from the 6th floor restaurant were quite spectacular - 180 degrees of the city. The room itself was quite comfortable with temperature setting controls. Unless you are staying at the front of the hotel, do not expect much of a view. The upper floors at the front have views of the 2 famous mosques. The lighting in the rooms leaves a lot to be desired. In my opinion, the total wattage (even when all 3 lamps are turned on) is less than reading quality. While I am all for energy conservation, the hotel may want to look at making the reading light a bit brighter - even if the others stay the same. Again, for a short stay, no issue. For a longer period, this could become a problem. We did request a wake-up call on the day of departure as we had an early flight to catch - which never came but we also had a backup using our phone. The hotel acknowledged this was their error and it was no big deal in the end for us. I will definitely use again if staying in Istanbul for less than a week.

Reviews.Title: “Location in the center of the Istanbul universe”
Reviews.Author: EcoArtTraveler
Reviews.Content: This comfortable little hotel is in the narrow streets of the old town, along with a lot of other cute little hotels, but this one has a fabulous rooftop dining room and view. Don't miss it at night! Very clean, friendly staff, diverse and tasty breakfast buffet, up-to-date and well-appointed rooms. It is within easy walking distance of everything from Topkapi to the Suleymaniye Mosque to the Grand Bazaar to dozens of great restaurants. Price (about $125) was very reasonable. Tram stop also very close. You can prearrange for a shuttle, but you need to call the hotel when you get to the airport and wait for it ... doesn't cost that much more just to take a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: dwhitmar
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Rast Hotel. The rooms were nice and clean, the complimentary breakfast had a wonderful selection plus a terrific staff waiting on you. It was located just a couple of blocks away, (very short walk), from the Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapa Palace, many other historical sites, as well as the grand bazaar. The view from the terrace was fantastic! The staff was very helpful, courteous, and spoke English. They assisted us in booking a river trip having us picked up and dropped back off at the hotel. One of the few hotels that could accommodate more than 2 people in a room. They also had a luggage room where they held our bags for the rest of the day after we had checked out. Two computers to use downstairs, free Wi-Fi access in your room. Most of the historical attractions blocks away, a small shop right next door, an ATM across the street, and plenty of places to eat near just a block away there was no need for cabs everything was in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure !”
Reviews.Author: Alohanuiloa
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Rast Hotel for one night (pre-cruise). The location is wonderful as it is close to the main street in Sultanameth, so, everything interesting was within walking distance: shops, restaurants, the Blue Mosque, parks, public transportation, etc. The hotel itself is very clean, beautiful, has free internet, free massage chairs and nice front desk. Breakfast was great ! having some Turkish delights. Recepcionist Serkan was more than efficient, nice, smiling, helpful. Just perfect ! In case I return to Istanbul, which is almost certain, I will defenitily stay at Rast again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious breakfast, excellent location, very clean, outstanding view!”
Reviews.Author: smokeyjoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel really made our Istanbul trip comfortable - from the friendly front desk personnel to the lobby massage chairs, they really go all out to help revive you after a long day of walking in this beautiful, hilly city. The rooftop terrace is open 24 hours, so you can take photos at all hours of the day - and the views are just fantastic. I don't usually comment on breakfast buffets as I'm not a big breakfast person, but this buffet was just luxurious - all the typical things but then also cakes and dessert-like local treats - and escellent, friendly service. Very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Service "10"”
Reviews.Author: Teri H
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff -- front desk & breakfast cafe personnel get a "10" for service & friendliness . Nicely furnished, clean & comfortable room. The location is a PERFECT base from which to tour the old city sights. Breakfast quality and service exceeded most other 3/4 star hotels in Turkey that I experienced on this holiday....big bonus is rooftop views! I would DEFINITELY return to the Rast .

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly, clean and excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: K2136
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service specially upstairs in the restaurant from two service ladies ! Very clean and nice rooms Fantanstic pricing and very near to Tram Line, and Sultanhamed

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Rast Hotel! We will miss you.”
Reviews.Author: Meher N
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Istanbul,Turkey for a long time in Rast Hotel. We had lots and lots of fun in our room and in Istanbul. Me and my family thought that you can just add a swimming pool+gym+library in your hotel or just take a place and build all this. We also thank you for the service you gave us and the taxi you served us with. We were happy because the room was clean and comfortable for our level. Sevji's and Fatima's smile used to make our day and thanks for the lunch,breakfast and dinner. I hope to see you in future.

Reviews.Title: “Super helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Kalogria H
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights at this hotel, which is very convenient for seeing the major sights. Ishan, Happy, Emre and others at the front desk went out of their way to advise and assist us; they recommended, for example, travel by tram on occasion, instead of taxi, which saved a great deal of time, not to mention money. They arranged guides, made many helpful suggestions and were unfailingly courteous and pleasant. Ishan even accompanied me, at his suggestion, to translate in a discussion about kniting with one of the street vendors. Breakfast was very enjoyable - topnotch breakfast choices, excellent tea and coffee, and the ever-smiling Sevgi and Fatma. We took lunch twice in the dining room - a convenient alternative to seeking out a neighbourhood eatery, of which there are a great many. The Rast lunch menu is inexpensive and has a number of choices. The four of us definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Orator12
Reviews.Content: I'm leaving the Rast today after a wonderful three day pre cruise stay. We were in Suie 501,truly a room with a view. The service couldn't have been better from Happy at the desk to Sevgi at the restaurant,all providing service and hospitality beyond expectations. We plan to return when next in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: theenglishfamily
Reviews.Content: WHAT A FIND! Superb location right in the centre of the Sultanhamet district. Friendly and helpful English-speaking staff. Amazing breakfast that really did set you up for the day & incredible views of the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia & Bosphorus from the dining room.

Reviews.Title: “At Rast Hotel Now”
Reviews.Author: sara k
Reviews.Content: Bad points first :Air conditioning is not working. After complaining for 2 days now we have been told by the staff that they controll the temperature centrally. On questioning about the temperature control mounted inside the room we were told that it is a sham and all the temperature is controlled centrally. They said that since these days as it is expected to get a bit chilly the ac has been turned off. This fact was revealed after complaining several times. We were told to keep the windows open to cool the room. Tried it but noise from outside kept us awake so had to close them.It gets really stuffy with windows closed 27 c. They told us to talk to the manager but he still hasn't shown his face after 2 days. Secondly, they state in their room brochure that they will provide 2 water bottles everyday without charge. Today, they did not deliver any. Asked receptionist for them at around 5pm . He said he will send them up. Rang him up again about 2 hours ago and same thing happened. In the end went out and got a bottle from the corner shop. The staff are very friendly but useless. Good points: Lovely view and good breakfast but after 2 sleepless nights you may not appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “L&M Amazing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lizkmar
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days in this lovely hotel. The view and location was wonderful. The staff were helpful in giving us directions, and arranging transportation for us . Cookie and Happy thank you for all of your help. We enjoyed the wide selection of food for breakfast and the view made it ever better. Great bathrooms, comfortable beds and everything was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view from the terrace”
Reviews.Author: Aysegul N
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, incredible view from the terrace. We loved it. Was certainly only 3+ stars, but it is in the Old City, and has heaps of character and charm. Booked it with Turkey Travel Centre - and can't say enough nice things about them - their office is right across the road from this hotel, so they came over and shouted us a drink when we checked in to welcome us. Nice service.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Dencal1945
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 days during a recent tour of Turkey. The location was perfect. Within 500 metres of the Sofia Mosque, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cisterns and just a little further to the Grand Bazaar. Just off the main street and close to many restaurants and eating places. The hotel itself is quite comfortable with rooms clean but of the "standard" size. Ours did have a view of the Blue Mosque which was great. The breakfast let the hotel down however. Milk was sour so obviously had not been examined previously, and selection of food was very limited. Reception staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: saabflyer
Reviews.Content: Clean, basic boutique hotel. Excellent location, friendly & helpful staff. Airport & port transfers well organised. Breakfast basic, but roof terrace had an amazing view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, pity about Basil Fawlty”
Reviews.Author: Stuart h h
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at rast for the start of our honeymoon, we found at that our room had not been cleaned and was not ready. We were kept waiting in the room whilst a member of staff disappeared. after waiting 10 minutes I went downstairs to see what was happening. I stated that I was not happy with the fact that we had recieved so poor a statrt to our honeymoon. The maitre d' was really rude, he asked me what i though he should do about the problem and that it was not his problem. I was really angry about the way we had been treated and actually walkled out of the hotel to book a room in one down the road. On my return the maitre 'd now told me that if I had been listening properly i would have heard him saty that he would find us another room. after travelling 12 hours I was too tired to argue. We were given a nice enough room. It was at the back of the hotel with an uninspring view of the back of a restaurant. On a positive note the breakfast at the hotel was really nice, the girls who worked there were very cheerful and polite and the view of hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque was impressive. None the less the rude attitude of the staff left my feeling quite negative toward this hotel. I would not recommend it to friends and would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: gerry008
Reviews.Content: four of us recently stayed 4 nights at Rast Hotel, it is well situated;not too expensive; has a roomy feel with large landings, though decor is dark Turkish;helpful staff and an excellent lift to a great terrace with wonderful views over theBlue Mosque and Hag Sophia. Breakfasts are excellent and we were perfectly looked after by the smiling Servgi. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: nss2232
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent base for exploring the old city and the location could not be better. It is conveniently located next to a tram stop or just a $15 cab fare to Taksim. We were pleasantly surprised by being upgraded to a suite on the 5th floor which had an unbelievable view. The breakfast was quite good and service friendly enough. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall OK”
Reviews.Author: MarieInDubai
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect and the hotel is ok, not unpleasant. The view from the terrace is great. I did not like the food (at all) and the decor is far too tacky for me. I specifically asked for a double bed and did not get it. We had to push the single beds together (as suggested by the staff, yes thanks for the help!)... Not bad, not great: average ++

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing experience!”
Reviews.Author: nitwit29
Reviews.Content: We had a very bad experience with one of the hotel staff members. The hotel was overbooked and they had given our room to someone else and instead of apologizing and requesting us to shift to the adjacent hotel for a night, this staff member told us that he was helpless and could not do anything. He did not admit that it was the hotel's mistake that they were overbooked, but instead lied to us and told us that a person had fallen ill and had to stay back. We found out later from another staff member the actual reason was overbooking. He was a very arrogant person and spoke very rudely to us and told us that he would do us a favour by giving us a free dinner. We did not accept the dinner in the end and were throughly disgusted by his attitude. He did not attend to us and wasted an hour of ours during check in. The next day we were promised the best room if we checked in late, but again he gave us the smallest room and when we approached him, he was not helpful and told us that he could not do anything and that we should speak to the manager. We were there for 4 nights, but the manager was never around and did not even have the courtesy to call us up. On the third day, we were finally given a big room. The hotel is otherwise nice and even the breakfast was quite adequate and good and the other staff members were very nice. The location of the hotel is also good and is quite convenient. The grand bazaar and the blue mosque are all at a walking distance. They also have a nice massage chair downstairs. Overall, the hotel is good, except for that one staff member.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dreveses
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly staff, the best view from the terrace. I stayed there with my family for 5 nights and everything was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “what a great hotel, and we will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: jackieCherryHill_Nj
Reviews.Content: When we walked in to the Rast Hotel, the manager brought us tea and sat us down to explain what we must see over the planned three days we were going to be there. The location is perfect, steps away from the Blue Mosque, Hagy Sofia, and other places. The rooftop breakfast is wonderful and the view at night is not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: diana12977
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, beautiful lobby, central location, great view from the roof, terrific breakfast, front desk service average, free internet in lobby. Overall, you get good value for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: DTtrip
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Rast Hotel after a long day plus of air travel. We were warmly greeted by the hotel staff and even taught a few Turkish pleasantries upon checkin. Imagine the awe when we opened the window of our room and had a panoramic view of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Topkapi Palace. The only view better was the one 2 floors up on the roof terrace. Room was very comfortable and clean. Easy wireless access. It's on a side street so you don't hear the road traffic, but the tram and access to restaurants and sites are right outside your doorstep. Definitely a great place to base out of while in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful gem”
Reviews.Author: alspeece
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first and last leg on our honeymoon in turkey! The hotel was in a perfect location- walking distance from all of the important sights in the Old Town. The breakfast was very good, and the view was spectacular. The rooms were very well maintained, as well as the richly decorated lobby. Most of the time they also had complementary juice and pastries in the waiting area. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great view.”
Reviews.Author: Wales_011
Reviews.Content: Couldnt of asked for a better hotel, reception staff very polite and helpfull always. The location is right in the centre of Sultanamet so easy to walk to all the attractions. The breakfast ( fantastic choice) is served on the roof terrace which has spectacular views of both the Aya Sofia and Sultanamet Mosques. The standard room which we stayed in was roomy with a small french balcony looking over the side street and was spottlessly clean. There are 2 x computors in the foyer for guests to use free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel with an excellent view”
Reviews.Author: LeeDubai
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was very convenient, just off the main street from the shops and plenty of restaurants. Walking distance to the main sights like Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Grand Bazaar. Also just minutes from the tram station. We had the triple room with an extra bed, which made the room much smaller but still fairly comfortable once you put away the luggages in the corner. We still got a bed each! We were at the top floor and had a very small balcony which was nice as we could have nice breeze. Some slight street noise but it was alright. However, we found the carpet a little too dusty. Breakfast was served at the top floor and the view was magnificient. The Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya were just beautiful. If you are into photography, an excellent spot!! The hotel staff was very friendly, especially Sevgi and Tutkur who simply adored our little girls. The girls loved breakfast time when they can see them. Service was excellent too. Unfortunately, during one of the nights, our elder girl could not stop vomiting and we had to take her to the hospital. Thanks to the night reception on duty, our taxi came very quickly. Also, in the lobby, they have 2 massage chairs - excellent for your tired legs. Overall, we will definitely stay here on our next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: lachie255060
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here. As it was the end of a 2 month holiday we lashed out for a suite with a large balcony with the most amazing views of the city and the Bospheros and were not disappointed. However, we know people who were staying in other rooms and they were happy too. Good breakfast is served on rooftop. There is a restaurant open at night but we did not try it. Location is so central to all the sights of Istanbul and plenty of restaurants, cafes etc surrounding. Free internet. Reception staff were helpful, but the breakfast room staff were delightful. Help yourself tea and coffee available in restaurant all day plus there is juice and cake in reception. Smaller hotel with less than 30 rooms so no worry of huge tour groups monopolising the breakfast area. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views, fabulous service and help with sightseeing/restaurants and comfortable accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug525
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful welcome from the staff. They gave us great advice on how to spend the day. The view from the restaurant on the 6th floor is amazing. The room was comfortable and free wireless was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “house in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hamza1903
Reviews.Content: my vocation was too short, generally this kind of hotels, you have to spend lot of time to say something. but rast hotel provided it in short time, from locaton to restaurant and personel to servis everything was wonderful, just do the only thing enjoyyy with istanbul...

Reviews.Title: “just great”
Reviews.Author: londra2011
Reviews.Content: amazing location and great view from the breakfast room room exactly how described and pictured in the website very clean outstanding service from the staff highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Spoil yourself - great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: GayleAUS
Reviews.Content: The Rast is perfectly situated for all sights. Staff are friendly, attentive, efficient and extremely helpful. Enter a richly decorated foyer with luxurious seating - a lovely , quiet retreat from the manic pace. Rooms are beautifully furnished, modern and spacious with all essentials and a few thoughtful extras. Enjoy the stunningly panoramic vista over Sultanahamet and the Marmara beyond, from the huge balcony that you enter through the massive glass doors. Breakfast on rooftop terrace with same breathtaking views - if you can take your eyes off the view, the breakfast is huge and delicious - the perfect start to your day.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl65-3
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of spending two nights at the Rast Hotel it was the best hotel of our entire trip! Reception area was beautiful equipped with massage chairs, computer and a beautiful common area. Rooms are very large, clean and well appointed. Breakfast area on the 6th floor has the most beautiful view! The service was impeccable and staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location was perfect near all major sights in Sultanahmet. The Blue Mosque and Ayasofya are in your backyard. We will definitely be back. Thank you Mr. Happy and the rest of the Rast Hotel Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: AussiesOnTour2010
Reviews.Content: In common with the majority of reviews here, we found the location of the Rast hotel cannot be beaten. It is a short walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia, as well as many shops and restaurants. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable, and the staff attentive and helpful. The free transfer from the airport to the hotel was punctual, and the concierge was excellent in advising about sightseeing, taxis etc. We were very happy with our stay here, however, guests should be aware this hotel is 'dry' (i.e., no alcohol is served), which was disappointing as the view at night from the rooftop restaurant is beautiful, but we like to have wine with dinner, so we didn't repeat the experience after the first night - this should have been made clear in the hotel website. However, the hotel is an excellent, economic choice when staying in central Istanbul. We were impressed to find that Istanbul itself was very clean, with little litter or graffiti (unlike Athens!) and the public gardens and water fountains were beautifully kept, definately a 'must see' city on any European tour.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better.....................”
Reviews.Author: CNHoward
Reviews.Content: Couldn't be better, for location service and comfort. The Rast hotel is a 5 minute walk from most of the main Istanbul tourist sights, so it really couldn't be better located.....in fact I'm pretty sure that no other hotel is closer to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, etc. The management and staff of the Rast go out of their way to make sure that you're well taken care of. We could have no complaint at all about the service. They gave us a great recommendation for a nearby restaurant (Sir Evi). Wasn't as keen on the second recommended restaurant (Hos Seda) but no big complaints. Room was comfortable & well equippped. Great view from the breakfast room on the roof terrace. Pity that the hotel doesn't have an alcohol licence but there are dozens of nice bars and cafes within 5 minutes. Definately worth a go is the rooftop bar at the Pierre Loti Hotel (in the street behind the Rast, just round the corner)......you can sit and drink in a nice atmosphere whilst taking in the floodlit skyline of Istanbul (another great recommendation from the Manager at the Rast) All in all, we can highly recommend the Rast and thank the management & staff for a great stay! Chris & Lyn Howard TETBURY, Glos, UK

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and superb service”
Reviews.Author: ElPet
Reviews.Content: We arrived extremely late and were shown to our room, which had superb view of Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque both! The hotel has the best possible location, and breakfast can be enjoyed overlooking both of these historical buildings, the Bosphorus bridge and the strait. The furnishings are somewhat quaint, but fit the overall atmosphere of the hotel. The rooms were super clean and the staff extra friendly. The kitchen was closed and there was no room service available at the time -it was after midnight, but when I asked for some hot water and freshly squeezed lemon, it arrived in our room within minutes. The next morning, the manager of the hotel, Tank Paksoy, offered us a guide, as well as advice regarding places to eat/shop. We loved the hotel, the fact it was small and so easily accessible and the superb views from our room and from the top-floor terrace. Finally, the taxi driver booked to take us to the airport was polite and his car was clean -we paid at the hotel and not the driver, but found the rate to be very good -and this is a trip we have done more than once- as was the rate offered for our booking. We will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: hahashahid
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Rast Hotel. The staff were very professional and went out of their way to help us and make our stay more comfortable. The first room we stayed in was a little small, but they changed it for us when we asked them to the next day. They have free internet and wifi, massage chairs in the lobby, a cafe with an excellent view of the blue mosque and hagia sofia and the location is just perfect. Located at walking distance from major sites and two minutes from the tram stop. The breakfast buffet could use a little improving though. Overall, we had a great experience at the Rast Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, helpful staff, great view”
Reviews.Author: onurbmot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 5 minutes walking to Hagia Sophia and The Blue Mosque. 5 minutes in the other direction takes you to the Burnt Column (Cemberlitas) and the Turkish bath, Cemberlitas Hamami. Good breakfast, we stayed in room 502, just one floor below the top floor breakfast room. We selected a room with exterior balcony which was worth the splurge to have a large room with perfect view of the Hagia Sophia and The Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with a fantastic location and very good service”
Reviews.Author: alecongua
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel in Aug 2009 as part of our honeymoon. We spent 3-4 days over there. Our stay was great, from the beginning to the end. Even though Istambul is a large city, they sent a van to pick us up at the international airport. Personnel was very friendly (especially a fellow the the concierge, named Mesut Erdogan, nickname Happy- I still keep his card). The view from the hotel restaurant (on the last floor) was simply gorgeous. I think it is one of the best places to see the sunset in Sultanahmet. My only complain would be that our room had a kind of foul smell when we got there. Otherwise, it was perfect. I would definitively go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely 5 days in Rast Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scot130
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Rast Hotel in Feb 2011. We had the Bosphorus suite-room 501- on the 5th floor. Lovely clean, comfortable room with a large balcony looking over to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the sea in the distance. We found the staff very helpful and the situation of the hotel excellent. A short walk to either of 2 tram stops, plenty of nearby restaurants. Lived up to the reviews of other Trip Advisor travellers. breakfast was included in the price and there was a selection of sweet/savoury items on offer, all eaten with a lovely view of the blue mosque. Only downside was the room had no kettle. Staff were happy to fill a flask for us but would,ve been better to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and excellent staff!!”
Reviews.Author: GMB95
Reviews.Content: We had really comfortable and enjoyable 4 nights in this hotel. Excellent location and excellen staff made our stay very cozy. All staff are very frindly and helpful.. particularly thanks to Mr. Erdogan.. he helped us a lot and made our stay in Istanbul so wonderful and memorable. The hotel is so close to the Blue Modque, Topkapi Palace, St. Sophia Museum, Grand Bazzar.. etc... So many shops and restaurants are within walking distance. Great view from the breakfast room. Only one problem was that we smelled cigarettes a lot in our room, but other than that we had no complain at all. We were just so happy to stay in this hotel. Definitely we'd like to stay in this hotel again in our next Istanbul trip !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Khizerq
Reviews.Content: Iv come here over the winter and it's freezing. However the hotel made the holiday. With great romantic views from the terrace I would say its the best location in Istanbul. Bear in mind this is my 4th time here and never stayed here. I will always come back. Clean, spacious, good breakfast, fantastic location. Can't wait to book in summer

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: MKEuropeanTraveler
Reviews.Content: From the time that we arrived (even though we were jet-lagged) the hotel staff was so accommodating. They showed us our rooms, brought us tea in the lobby and planned out our stay in Istanbul. The manager told us when places were crowded, recommended great restaurants, got a driver for our trip to the Asian side, and another driver for the Turkish bath. Everything turned out well and we felt like we had the staff to thank for it. The rooms were clean and well appointed. The breakfasts were good and were on the top floor where you could see all of Istanbul...quite incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very friendly. It is close to all the main attractions like the bazar and the mosques you'd want to see. The rooms are clean. We stayed in a comfort double, the bed was nice, good linen, good soundproof. Bathroom was clean but small. No toothpaste, only downside.

Reviews.Title: “Second time we have stayed at the Rast-Will definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: theminns
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and adequate. View from the restaurant on the roof is amazing. Staff very helpful. Right in the middle of Sultanamet. Easy walk to the grand bizarre and the basilicaq cistern. Easy tram ride to the spice souk. Cost-stayed for free as the tour company we went with before said if we returned, we could stay for free. Thanks again veni vidi

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value - a superb 3*”
Reviews.Author: at12am
Reviews.Content: I would say this is an excellent 3 stars and not quite a 4 star hotel due to tired decor. Location is excellent. Everyone is very cordial. Mr. Happy (his name) at the Front Desk is very eager and he would be happier if you book a tour through him. Here are the Pros and Cons. Pros: â€¢ Great location (30ft to tram line and main street) â€¢ Great view (Blue mosque and Aya Sofya) on roof breakfast/restaurant area â€¢ Waitress tending breakfast was friendly with a super smile â€¢ Soft bed and bed linen; friendly helpful staff Cons: â€¢ Lobby a little shabby â€¢ Rough & greyish towels â€¢ Elevator sometimes did not stop on the first floor â€¢ Some breakfast selection (buffet style) may not be very fresh A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: solewalker
Reviews.Content: The rooms are elegantly decorated, and the hotel is available at a good price. It is also at an excellent location - about 5 mins walk from the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia. You can see both of them when you enjoy the excellent breakfast at their rooftop restaurant, or just see how they light up in the evening. When I booked, Rast hotel had a deal where they had a free one-way airport transfer for staying with them three nights. That made getting to the hotel a breeze. Also, when I needed to get an international plug for my computer, the hotel staff ran out to buy some as they were out of them. I guess the least inspiring part of the hotel is probably their bathroom. But even then, it's not atrocious, just normal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Nuzia
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very friendly service especially "Happy" at reception who seemed to know exactly what we wanted sorted out our itinery and could not do enough for us...the same goes for other reception staff who were very helpful but I did not get their name....Thank You to you all. Eat as much as you like Turkish breakfast was lovely and set us up for the day. The view from the 6th floor terrace was absolutely amazing!!!!! The rooms were cosy but well furnished..... Altogether a fantastic trip!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: FloriConstantza
Reviews.Content: I booked Rast Hotel for three nights in december 2010. I was not dissapointed. The hotel is OK: nice rooms, very clean, the staff very nice. Also excellent the restaurant on the terace. The hotel is places near several points of tourism points of interests, in a lovely area with plenty of restaurants, shops ...It is a special place for us in Istanbul and we'll come back next year. Go and visit the hotel, you'll like it !

Reviews.Title: “the best location and the best service”
Reviews.Author: venanciogarcia
Reviews.Content: great location, walking distance to saint sophia, the blue mosque, the grand bazaar, etc... surronded by a lot of good restaurants... it s amazing to have breakfast with a breathtaking view of the blue mosque and saint sophia the hotel staff were extremely kind and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location. Incredible views from terrace-restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: madridrocks
Reviews.Content: Excelent location. Incredible views from terrace-restaurant. Good price-quality ratio. Execelent service. Decoration could be a lot better. Very good in general.

Reviews.Title: “Best view in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: nings
Reviews.Content: It is my first day in istanbul (my honeymoon!!). Rast hotel is near the tram, and they did early check in. We can get a good rest. Also the top view of hotel restaurant is really beautiful!! the breakfast is very delicious!! We had good day in Rast hotel. Thank you~

Reviews.Title: “Rast Hotel - Great hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: KuwaitiExpat
Reviews.Content: Reservation was made through the hotel website. We arrived late in the evening after a 6 days tour around Turkey. Rooms were ready and in good condition. Rooms are not that large, but it is to be expected from busy touristic area like Sultanahmet. Small bathroom but very nice and clean, very good water pressure, and hot water. The room is clean, the beds are very comfortable and we had good night sleeps. Even though the hotel located very close to a busy street, we can hardly hear anything from the room unless the doors to the balcony were opened. There is a safe large enough to store a laptop, and the wifi is very good and fast with strong signals all over. Quite a few power ports to enable charging several devices at one time. The restaurant on the 6th floor served excellent breakfast and dinners; have one of the best picturesque views of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia close by, with the Bosporus strait as background. We were spoilt for choice by the breakfast menus - cereals, pastries, cold cuts, cheeses, hot breakfast, fruits... The hotel is strategically located, just a few steps away from the main street in Sultanahmet where there are many shops, cafes and restaurants; a few minutes' walk from Sultanahmet Tram station; and also a few minutes walk from the area's main attractions: The Blue Mosque, The Hagia Sophia Museum and the Topkapi Palace. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful; they provide detailed info on local restaurants and places of interests, and ways of getting to other places worth visiting in Istanbul. Some friends stayed in other more expensive hotel in the area, but comparing their experience we believe Rast hotel offers a great value. It is a very nice boutique hotel in Sultanahmet, and the location and its people makes the hotel a very good choice if you want to visit Istanbul and stay in Sultanahmet to explore the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: Calyponte
Reviews.Content: Great location, steps from the street where the Tram runs but kind of in between stations so you have to walk 1+ block to either one. We found Sultanahmet to be the most convenient. In any rate, most of the attractions are within walking distance, even for my 92 year old Dad. For other places to visit you can either ride the Tram or arrange a tour. They have brochures in the lobby, but the front desk staff have their own little tour business going and they get a commission for each tour they arrange. Theyâ€™re much more economical that the ones in the brochures. You need to make sure that what you plan or arrange with the evening staff is given to you in writing and if you pay a deposit GET A RECEIPT. Luckily we did that because the next morning the front desk staff had no idea of what we were talking about so it was essential we had a receipt signed and rubber stamped with the Hotel logo. Our private day tour was excellent in the end, our guide Hakan Kutlu (www.101-turkey.com) was great, very personable and passionate about his countryâ€™s history and eager to show us and answer all our questions.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: acm1508
Reviews.Content: hotel is just perfect for sightseeing, main attractions and shopping really great brekfast room with wonderful views bed nice and firm just wat is needed after a long day sightseeing and liked the energy saving scheme at the hotel the staff was very helpful and pleasant nothing was too much just like everybody else I met in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bert07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal place to visit all that Istanbul offers.and has fabulous views.All the staff are most welcoming and courteous and we spent four very comfortable and wonderful days.

Reviews.Title: “good location and friendly stuff”
Reviews.Author: m_seyda_y
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel is really good. All main atractions are in 5 minutes walking distance. The roof top restorants view is amazing. You can see all city panaromicly. And also stuff in restourant is always smiling at breakfast. I feel like in my home. The hotel was so crowdy because of Ramadan (muslims speciad days). Restourant was noisy arround 6pm to 9pm. At first dat they gave me a small room but the they changed my room with a deluxe one and it was very comfortable. I advise this hotel especially for cultural trips.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: chanmary46
Reviews.Content: The location is really great, the stuff is friendly, kind and very helpful and the rooms clean and comfortable. The situable place to feel the colour and the scent of this magic city not the international one!!!Alcohol is not allowed but that is not actually a problem......Sometimes it ia better....I would stay there again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “The Staff (front desk) let this place down badly”
Reviews.Author: PaulyOnHerOwn
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the rooms average and the price ok but perhaps a bit high considering the overall experience. Bring your own toilet paper, as they are consistently stingy, bring your own water as they don't give you a new bottle daily, and beware the beds are a little too firm. The staff - some are ok, but the front desk guy is absolutely awful. Bad attitude, bordering on offensive. I specifically refer to the people at the front desk. They do not even honour the bookings you make for airport pick-up and drop-off, turning up an hour late on the pick-up, and changing their mind last-minute on the drop-off as they considered it too early (so I got a taxi). Honestly, the main front desk guy has a seriously bad attitude, with a surly face, grumpy demeanour (very UNhappy) seems sarcastic and disrespectful. I had previously stayed at this very same hotel for > 1 week and was treated slightly better the 1st time, and left this SAME UNhappy man a full bottle of left-over French champagne. This time, only 12 months later, he denies even recognising me, despite the driver, restaurant staff etc all remembering me very well. If they get rid of this employee, it would be to their advantage. I have read others' comments below also referring to this UNhappy employee as sarcastic etc. Tarik - please take this feedback seriously, as I genuinely believe your hotel is better than the man on your front desk. I won't be coming back unless he is gone.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GET CAUGHT OUT”
Reviews.Author: Mayu7
Reviews.Content: Having confirmed booking through BA when we reached our hotel they did not have room for us and wanted us to move for one night to their sister hotel, which seems like a very common practice in Istanbul (same thing happened to another couple travelling with us with different hotel). One way transfer is included in the package but no one turns up at the airport for pick up. Beware they will quote you price in Liras and when it comes to paying they will say that the price was quoted in Euroes(which is double the cost). Staff are very helpful. Breakfast needs some change as it is very basic compared with other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not impressing”
Reviews.Author: Aglasis
Reviews.Content: A main advantage of this hotel is its location: close to the main sightseeings. The staff is perfect and helpful (actually, like almost everyone citizen in Istanbul). The rooms are small though it's hard to find a hotel with big rooms within the Sultanahmet area. We didn't hear the tram and traffic at nights so our sleep quality was perfect. To sum up, it's a common hotel for 120 euros per night. So you can choose any one you liked.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Crampmoor
Reviews.Content: Must be a very popular hotel as I couldn't book the room I wanted! Fantastic location. We were able to walk to all the major locations. Two way transfer to the airport was very efficient. Good choice at breakfast with a view to die for. The room was small but it didn't really matter too much to do in the city. The staff were charming and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location combined with courteous, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: IDontCare095
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located within 400 m of Blue Mosque, fabulous view from rooftop restaurant. Staff was courteous, friendly, and very helpful. Our room was very clean, but a little crowded for two people although this was not a significant inconvenience. Would definitely stay again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location for major sites in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: voetsa
Reviews.Content: nicely furnished rooms, friendly persons at the reception desk and beautiful view on the Roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money!”
Reviews.Author: DrSouche
Reviews.Content: Amazing views, perfect place and amazing service. Can we ask for anything else?

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient but lacks organisation”
Reviews.Author: bluemonk6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived late in Istanbul on Sunday night after a two hour delay to our flight and thankfully the collection we had arranged with the hotel was waiting for us. When we arrived at the hotel we were assigned a room that was already occupied. The obviously embarassed porter went back down to the reception desk and found we were meant to be in a different room on another floor. We had booked a room with a king size bed but the room we were assigned had three single beds. I spoke to the reception desk and was told there was nothing they could do about it and maybe in three or four days they could change our room. I said that we had been charged and already paid for a room that we were not being given and he said he would make a note of it for the morning staff. As it was near midnight and we had travelled for many hours we had no option but to take it for that night. The following morning, Monday, I went to the reception desk and explained that we had not been given the room we had booked and paid for. They were unaware of this so it seems that the night porter made no note as he said he would. They reluctantly changed the room and said they would move us to the type of room we booked and that they would move our luggage into the room when it was ready while we went sightseeing for the day. When we came back in the evening our room had been changed but when we went in our luggage was nowhere to be seen. I went down to the reception and there seemed to be confusion over who was supposed to be moving it. After several calls to various people and searching the room we first had and the left luggage room by reception, it turned out after about a half hour of searching that our luggage had been left in someone else's room. The room we were given was clean and comfortable and very well equipped and I was happy with it. On Wednesday morning we were woken early by a wake up call that we had not requested. I explained this on the first call but they still called back twice more. We had to be at the airport for 9am on Friday morning so on Thursday evening I arranged a transfer from the hotel to the airport to ensure we would be on time. However, when I arrived at the reception for my transfer they were unaware of it and the driver was at the airport collecting other guests. I got the receptionist to order a taxi which turned up aboout three minutes later. The hotel is very close to many of the main sights that are within easy walking distance. The view from the rooftop breakfast room is excellent and for photographers there is a good view of the Blue Mosque and the Haigha Sophia as the sun sets. There are many restaurants on the street close by but the food is fairly mediocre. However, the section of the Ticarethane Sok just off Divanyolu has the better restaurants in the area, I would particularly recommend Evim and Rumeli Cafe. I enjoyed the city and the sights but the only negative part was the confusion there seemed to be in the organisation in the hotel itself. One of the most annoying things with the litany of mistakes made was that at no point were we offered an apology for any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - good views and handy for sights”
Reviews.Author: quizzer43
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of the terrace cafe's view of the Blue Mosque. It was as good as I thought it would be. Also very handy for all the main sights and the tram and the little shop next door sold cold water. Our room could have been a bit bigger. The staff were very obliging. Our only gripe was the poor breakfast which was very limited. By the end we were down to just juice and coffee. It will be a while before I can face melon again. But I chose this hotel because of what was important to us and on that it delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Great view in the suite”
Reviews.Author: breeze1024
Reviews.Content: The suite room on the 5th floor has a great view. The location is ideal. The service is great. The staff is really helpful. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Clean ad quiet in top location”
Reviews.Author: Katrin1979
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in the Rast hotel for 3 nights in August 2010. The hotel is in a superb location in Sultanahmet, only 10mins walk from the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia. The area is safe and you can walk without any problems at night. The rooms are clean, the beds new and the windows very well isolated, so you barely hear any noise from outside, even though the street is quite busy ad with a tram way. The balcony is really miniature and you cannot actually sit on it, but therefore you can enjoy a superb view from the roof top terrace during breakfast. A nice extra were the massage seats situated on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep in a year”
Reviews.Author: AbuDhabiDragon
Reviews.Content: Second visit to Rast and once again it was great, the pillows must be the best ever. Close to everything you need to visit in the old part of city , staff always helpful. Will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Good and convenient place for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: szeyiu
Reviews.Content: good points: 1) good location and just few minutes walking to major sightseeing spots 2) free transfer available 3) friendly and helpful staff bad point: 1) room is small

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, centrally located and friendly hotel with wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: sjhHove
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days staying at the Rast Hotel in Istanbul. This excellent, friendly hotel is just off one of the main streets. It is 10 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sophia etc and close to the Sultanahmet tram stop. The rooms are comfortable and clean, all en suite. The air conditioning is effective as is the double glazing. They provide a good Turkish style breakfast and the dining room has amazing views across the rooftops to Hagia Sophia and the Bosphorus. This is an excellent middle range hotel which is very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean room, efficient staff, reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Mandy105
Reviews.Content: We selected Rast Hotel from internet. It was a good choice. We received a free tansfer from the airport. The hotel has an excellent location; all historic attractions are in a walking distance. Galata bridge, Taksim can be reached also easily by tram.The staff was polite, efficient; they gave us good advice where to go, what to see. Our room was clean all the time. The restaurant on the 6th floor has a fantastic view over the city and the Bosporus. We received good breakfast. We enjoyed our stay and recommend Rast Hotel to any solo or family visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & staff, but you can find cheaper in same area”
Reviews.Author: nodaicrag
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice for Istanbul standards. The strongest recommendation would be attributed to their location and helpful, friendly hotel staff. Their website, and hotels.com mentions complimentary airport transfer, but it fails to clarify that it is one way only -- that is from the airport to the hotel only. When you return to the airport, it is a 25 euro charge. Breakfast included. Great view from their top floor restaurant balcony. The beds in our room are standard twin size, firm mattress with a mattress pad type comforter and the quilt cover on top. There are no flat sheets to accompany the quilt cover on top. Small TV with cable provided, but doesn't matter anyway since you're not here to watch TV. If you want to stay in this area for less, there are many hotels with the location, but without the one-way airport transfer, wifi, breakfast included and air conditioning. If you don't mind spending about USD 120 during July/August, then this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located with a great roof terrace and very service minded staff”
Reviews.Author: TEA46
Reviews.Content: We can highly recommend this hotel with its perfect location. Very friendly staff and wonderful view from the roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Location cant be better”
Reviews.Author: Emad07
Reviews.Content: Very nicely located to almost every thing. We Saw most of attractions on foot. Tram station is 2 minutes walk. Food is expensive so we ate outside. Very beautiful view of Blue mosque and Aya Sofia from the terrace. Rooms are relatively small but still comfortable enough. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrace with an extraordinary view!”
Reviews.Author: MRCPAntwerp
Reviews.Content: Rast hotel is ideally situated for all highlights of Istanbul (Topkapi, Agia Sophia, etc. within walking distance). A free transfer from AtatÃ¼rk Airport is included, which is very handy when you arrive in a huge city as Istanbul. The welcoming was very warm; the staff was very friendly (but also very discrete, if the guest wishes so) and gave us some hints and tips about things to see and restaurants offering a good value for money in the neighbourhood. The rooms are well equipped and offer all comfort needed. Breakfast (buffet) is in the restaurant on the top floor with a superb view on the Agia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, really incredible view on the typical skyline of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: linda_travel_review
Reviews.Content: The Rast hotel is one of the very best hotels I have stayed in Istanbul. This is my 14th trip to this city and have had several published hotel reviews since 1987. Hotel is situated in a small street with other small hotels, a few feet away from the tram. Location is quiet and perfect after a busy tiring day visiting all the nearby sights at Sultanahmet. Everything is conveniently walking distance to the restaurants, shopping areas and the Grand Bazaar. Price is right, too. Breakfast is always plentiful; fresh and filtered coffee is served . You cannot beat the view of the Blue Mosque and Hagya Sofia from the roof while enjoying your meals or drinks. Staff goes out of their way to make your stay pleasant and memorable. If you want the hustle and bustle of the old city, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great View”
Reviews.Author: Ralphx
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in perfect place. Walking distance to the main point of interest in Istanbul. Incredible view at the breakfast terrace.

Reviews.Title: “great location in the old town”
Reviews.Author: oneroa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on two separate occasions firstly in one of the suites (rooms 501 and 502) and then in a standard room. The suite was excellent with stunning views of the Blue Mosque and if you can afford the extra then it is a must. The standard room is just fine for a European hotel. The best part was the location, handy and within walking distance to all the major sites. All in all a great hotel with very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Love Istanbulus.”
Reviews.Author: JMT33
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Location, Fantastic Staff. If you are hesitating, my advice is: If you can afford this lovely wee gem in the hEART of Istanbul then simply go ahead and book it. Loved It !!! What a lovely, hospitable, accommodating, courtious, friendly, nation of people. I simply cannot fault them. Couple this with the stunning architecture and you have all the ingredients of a great holiday. Take a walk along the water front on a Thu/Fri/Sat evening. Bliss, Enjoy Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “excellent...this review is a copy of the e-mail i forwarded to the hotel manager”
Reviews.Author: jerichoLiverpool
Reviews.Content: I would like to thankyou for a most enjoyable stay at your hotel. My friend and I had a wonderful time and found the room and the hotel decor exquisite. The food was outstanding. The staff were impecable and extremly helpful, please pass on my sincere thanks . I will highly reccomend your hotel to my friends and will definatley be staying with you again the next time I visit Istanbul. I will certainly update a review on the sites requested and will provide an excellent report of your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, challenging room”
Reviews.Author: Sunny51
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, a short walk from everything in the old city. Staff was extremely helpful. Room was tiny, even by European standards. Bed was hard and air conditioning not quite sufficient. I would recommend during a cooler time of year to people who can sleep on a hard bed.
