Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel. To be recommended to anyone travelling to Istambul”
Reviews.Author: eduardo_cariglino
Reviews.Content: Both my wife and I felt very comfortable at the hotel, though we missed a french bed (queen or king size), that was not available at the room. All the facilities were extremely clean and in good shape. The location of the hotel and the view from its terrace are superb.

Reviews.Title: “great location .....”
Reviews.Author: DubaiAmanda
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Rast hotel recently for a weekend with friends here are my comments on the rast: Location - fantastic right in the middle of everything. Nothing is a long walk away the blue Mosque etc. etc. Also the view from the top floor cafe is breathtaking it looks like something out of a movie. Rooms - Small nothing special, glass window between the bathroom and bedroom and has a blind in it but not 100 percent privacy! I would say 3 star standard. Food - breakfast is served 7 - 10 on the first day we went down at 8am and food nice and hot. On second day we went down at 9am and the breakfast was cold not impressed. Staff - helpful but there were occassions where they encouraged us to get a cab...only for us to get stuck in traffic for ages and find out the the ferry terminal would have been a 10min walk! so this was really annoying. Communal areas - very nicely decorated. All in all a good hotel but the rooms a little small and dingy and just wish the guys were more helpful with information rather than trying to sell us tours etc.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has it all”
Reviews.Author: RobH888
Reviews.Content: The Rast hotel is a small friendly hotel in the heart of old Istanbul. The hotel has incredibly helpful and friendly staff and enjoys arguably the best location in the City easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome and City Cistern. This hotel is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel, very comfortable and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: amandinejacques
Reviews.Content: The hotel indeed is brand new, very comfortable, with spacious rooms, comfortable beds, good isolation for outside noises. The hotel terrace for breakfast (and other eventual meals) has a splendid view on Saint Sophia church and the Blue Mosquee. The personnel is friendly, fluently english speaking and will do what they can to help us with our querries. The location is also ideal: right on the tramway line (but without the tramway noises!) and 5 min from the blue mosquee.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous and helpful staff, brilliant location and stunning view of the city.”
Reviews.Author: Constance27
Reviews.Content: We found the staff in reception and at breakfast particularly helful and courteous at all times. Nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is well situated for all the major sites and on a tram route for places further afield. There are reasonable places to eat close by and the hotel itself has a cafe/restaurant with a stunning panoramic view of the city's famous mosques and the sea. The room was a good size with a balcony and a modern bathroom. The free airport shuttle service added to the excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A small pearl in the range of new brand hotels”
Reviews.Author: TravellerPilot
Reviews.Content: nice terrasse (restaurant) on the upper floor, with amazing look-out over the old town of Istanbul, very good Turkish breakfast, friendly guys in the reception, small but tidy rooms

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location, quiet and clean...”
Reviews.Author: travellerJervisBay
Reviews.Content: From the pick up service to the return to the airport we were very well looked after by all Rast Hotel staff. The hotel is in a great location to sight see all of old Istanbul. To see new Istanbul just catch the tram which is a few steps from the hotel. The hotel was very quiet considering its fantastic location. The view from the breakfast area was amazing. It is also steps away from many great restaurants. The room 406 was comfortable and quiet. The staff were very helpful even supplying an umbrella when it was raining. We were very happy spending the 3 nights at the Rast Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous views”
Reviews.Author: AreIzqS
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic 5-days stay at Rast hotel in may 2010. Everything was OK and the view from the top floor (the restaurant) was incredible. Nice rooms and nice staff also helped make our stay a fabulous one. Highly recomendable!

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Davies46
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Istanbul but unfortunately the courtesey hotel car that was supposed to meet us at the airport did not arrive . However, we got a yellow cab to the hotel without any difficulty. We were warmly welcomed and given complementary tea and biscuits and were assured that they would provide a taxi free of charge back to the airport, which they did.. Our room was on the fifth floor at the back of the hotel and was very pleasant. The restaurant was on the 6th floor with spectacular views over Istanbul. The food was excellent with plenty of choice. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and provided us with sound advice.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Cajuche
Reviews.Content: Have to agree with everyone on this hotel - I highly recommend it to all who are looking for the best location, awesome views and terrific serivce. Breakfast was outstanding and the view of Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque made it just perfect. Rooms were always clean and the location in Sultanahmet is unbeatable. You cannot go wrong here and we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “this is outstanding location with terrace views to live in the memories forever”
Reviews.Author: noucamp006
Reviews.Content: all the staff are friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them.Thank you Mr Ben Happy and the ever smiling Sergie in the restaurant.Can recommend this hotel for location hospitality and easy for seeing all the wonderful sites

Reviews.Title: “It located in a awesome location but it pose a challenge to local taxi criver.”
Reviews.Author: Jannice
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a awesome location. Roof top view was fantastic but the room is a bit small as compare to the hotel that we stayed earlier at Takzim area. Good breakfast provided but i think hotel need a bit of renovation as i saw some flooding near the glass panel when it is raining. Anyway, i would love to stay back if i am back to Istanbul for holiday again.

Reviews.Title: “Good find in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: 10LeagueBoots
Reviews.Content: Not knowing anything about Istanbul, I found and stayed at The Rast Hotel twice in April. The hotel was a great value and perfectly located within easy walking distance of all of the major Istanbul sights, including the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topcapi Palace. The staff was very helpful and the roof top breakfast was very good with an even better view.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: 1323PL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and our room was comfortable if a little small. The rooftop breakfast room is particularly delightful on a bright sunny morning with fabulous views of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Topkapi palace - all wthin easy walking distance. The staff were especially helpful throughout our stay. All in all - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel: location, staff, amazing view from rooftop restaurant”
Reviews.Author: FrMetrie
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay at the Rast, after trying the other places in the same area the years before. Helpful and friendly staff, clean and quiet rooms. Very convenient location, close to the main places of interest, the tram and lots of restaurants. Good breakfast , wide choice and hot items (different every day), smiling waiters, special mention to Sevgi who helped me practise my Turkish! Wonderful view from the restaurant . Would certainly go back and recommend this place. One (very) minor drawback: internet doesn't always work very well (slow) Francoise & Dominique METRIE (FRANCE)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gi76
Reviews.Content: Transfer from airport to hotel and back appreciated, great location, close to many tourist points, friendly welcome, sympatic staff, well RECOMMENDATIONS, the room we had was very spacious, breakfast on the terrace with wonderful view on the city and the Bosphorus, good tariff rates on WEEKDAYS, weekends a bit more expensive, but overall price acceptable

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: KajsaHelsinki
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent, spacy room (suite) with a balcony with a marvellous view. It was a treat to get up in the morning and look out of the window. The staff was helpful and avid, they really tried their best to make us feel welcome. Breakfast was good and the terasse was lovely. There could have been some more tables and chairs on the terasse enabling more guests to enjoy their breakfast outside in the sun. When you come to sunny Istanbul from a foggy and snowy Finland there is nothing more you want than to sit outide in the sun and enjoy a good breakfast and the really breathtaking view.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, comfortable Hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: HeWeMunich
Reviews.Content: We experienced very good service. The People at the reception were very friendly, helpful and gave us excellent advice about how to get around in Istanbul and what to see. The "on demand" shuttle service from and to the airport is very good. The location is perfect, in walking distance from many sightseeing points and nearby nice restaurants and bars. The rooms are very cosy (maybe a bit small) and the breakfast room with the view over the Blue Mosque is great. The breakfast is good and the selection varies from day to day. There are massage chairs in the hotel lounge that one can use for free - we enjoyed them!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TatsuNagoya
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean. The staffs were very kind. The location is very convenient for sightseeing and shopping. Although we had asked rooms with bath tub, one of two was not. My computer could not connect with internet by wireless net of the hotel although the staffs assisted me a lot.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: pchri
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, best location in town, near to all major monuments, impressive sight view. The hotel was spotless clean, the staff very kind. I recommend this hotel to everyone who visit istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Best Budget Hotel with the most preferred location in the city”
Reviews.Author: sid123ag
Reviews.Content: it was awesome, their room sizes are considerably good and has very good in house staff who is always ready to help..the location of the hotel is in the europian side of the istanbul city and the best part is its on walkin distance from tram stations and other tourist points..

Reviews.Title: “excellent accomodation and high sense of hospitality”
Reviews.Author: libero82
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel: you'll love the breakfast time and the location!!! Highly recommended!!! good price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Harriet68
Reviews.Content: During our trip to Istanbul last week we stayed in this pleasent hotel in the centre of the area Sultanahmet, where all te historic sights are located. The Topkapi palace, the blue mosque, Hagia Sofia and the grand bazaar are all to be reached within a short walk from the hotel. The hotel was very comfortable and clean. The restaurant, with terrace, is situated on the rooftop, with a magnificant view over the city and the Bosporus. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. We had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dobermann883
Reviews.Content: Great position near pubblic transport and major cultural Sightseeing, great staff..in a few words: the right place to stay if you go to Instanbul..and you should do!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MartinZagreb_Croatia
Reviews.Content: location of the hotel is really good in relation to the main sights and in relation to tram connections with other parts of the city, great staff especially in the restaurant on the 6 floor, rooms are very comfortable and clean, especially we liked the view from 6 floor where is a restaurant, mostly good value for money, a serious recommendation

Reviews.Title: “very high value for money”
Reviews.Author: SofiaYellow
Reviews.Content: the location is great; the interior is very good; the triple room was very spacious; friendly atmosphere;

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel. Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: BobPK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good in almost all aspects. The staff is fantastic, very helpful and forthcoming. The room (standard double) was small but quite comfortable. The bathroom is very clean and well planned, though also small. The breakfast is very good and the view from the breakfast terrace is absolutely terrific. I would definitely stay there again. On the negative side is the noise from the restaurant on the 6th floor was heard in our room at the 5th floor (room 504). When we asked to move to another room, it was done right away. So we can only praise the staff for quick and positive response to our request. The only real negative experience we had at the hotel is related to the behaviour of the people in the neighboring room. They made tremendous noise at quite a bizarre times of night: one day at 2:30 am and the other day at 0:40 am. We didn't see them during the day and only know that they spoke spanish. Also in this case the reaction of the staff to our request to "silence" the noise was quick and efficient

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, friendly helpful staff, great breakfast and views!”
Reviews.Author: jiggerStirling_UK
Reviews.Content: Only downside was noise from adjacent room otherwise fantastic rooms, location, breakfast and view from terrace. Also really nice touch was gift of Turkish music CD which brings back great memories now I am back in UK.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel, Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Mthetraveler
Reviews.Content: We were quite satisfied with thr Rast Hotel. The rooms were pretty and comfortable, The staff was very helpful. The view was excellant. It was a good value in an expensive city. The location was perfect! Most of the major sites were in easy walking distance. The street car was very close for further away areas. The only thing that went wrong was the weather. It snowed, so it was really important to us that everything was so close. Istanbul was really amazing, it would be great to go at a better time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: ItArk
Reviews.Content: A great hotel located near to "almost everything" you have to see in Istanbul. Really serviceminded and caring staff. A really good breakfast is included - on the rooftop viewing Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Friendly & Informative Staff - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: steecitygirl
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 day stay at this hotel. It was a birthday present for my friend. we chose the hotel from previous comments made on trip advisor and we were not disappointed! The hotel is very close to the main attractions all within walking distance. The view from the terrace was breathtaking and absolutely nothing was too much trouble for the staff. We stayed for 4 nights and got a free pick up from the airport too. All round value for money and the weather was fabulous too. Enjoy your stay you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with very friendly helping staff”
Reviews.Author: travelerHolland
Reviews.Content: A very warm welcome. When we arrived we have got a nice cup of Turkish tea and the receptionist was very helpfull to tell us what to sea and where to eat in Istanbul. The room was nice and clean. The hotel is situated very close to the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia. In the breakfast room on top of the hotel you have an great view while having breakfast. The breakfast buffet is very good. A lot of things to chose and very fresh. Very friendly, helpfull staff. Great hospitality!!!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: DTWinfield
Reviews.Content: A very clean hotel. The view of the Blue Mosque from the restaurant was brilliant. The staff were excellent and food superb. We will stay there again soon. David and Marie Winfield

Reviews.Title: “Rast for rest, restaurants and great location.”
Reviews.Author: AbuDhabiDragon
Reviews.Content: The location was ideal, the rooms comfortable, the beds very comfortable and the staff were great. Staff were attentive, friendly and willing to provide advice and assistance at any time. Would certainly go back again. Receptionist Happi was super.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean rooms and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jimmy13london
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the rast hotel for 3 nights in february 2010 our room was a bit small, but clean the hotel is beautifully located in the old town, walking distance from the main attractions, with a great view from the terrace. the staff was fantastic and very helpful Good value and if you pay cash you get an extra 10% discount

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mimis_9
Reviews.Content: the people of the hotel made our honeymoon a memory to be remembered and we thank them from ou hearts

Reviews.Title: “Truly perfect hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ESquared2002
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and it was our first time in Istanbul. We were amazed of the high level of personal service by the entire staff. The hotel and room were extremely clean and the rooms were very spacious. We have travelled to many countries around the world and stayed at 5 star hotels and this service, location, and room are at that level. The views from the breakfast terrace are as good as it can get. We cant wait to go back and stay in the same place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff, very clean. I strongly recommend”
Reviews.Author: robertacanha
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a good location. You can find ereything near. all the staff were very kind with us during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: cgasrtwartgdg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Rast Hotel for a week in January, and was very satisfied with everything. The rooms are nice and clean, the service is very good and the location is excellent, with a great view to all of Sultanahmet from the breakfast room at the top floor. The hotel's airport transfer service was also very convenient. The free wireless Internet worked well too. Room prices seem to vary a bit depending on when you order - we got an excellent offer via Expedia where we paid only $42 per night for six nights. For that price, Rast Hotel is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LU39
Reviews.Content: We have just spend a long weekend in the Rast and were very positively surprised about the central location of the hotel. Most things are in walking distance and those which are not can easily been reached by using the Metro which departs two minutes away from the hotel. Staff are very very helpful and supportive and as soon as the realise it is one of the parties birthday they go an extra mile by serving birthday cake. The suites have a brilliant view and a wonderful terrace. Room size is not too big, but then again one hardly comes to Istanbul to spend much time in the hotel. Clearly can recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Why we didn't stay at the Rast!”
Reviews.Author: aussieexpats
Reviews.Content: Well, because they lost our booking! Several months before we arrived we had email contact to book our stay, then extend it, confirm the room we had booked and organise to be collected from the airport on arrival. Sadly we were not picked up and when we finally arrived at the hotel by taxi we were shown to a shoe box size room on the second floor, not the Hagia Sophia view room we had booked on the fifth floor. Fortunately we were travelling with a laptop and could show the staff exactly the email confirming our booking. However they could do nothing to give us the room we had booked. After our polite, silent but determined stand-off in the lobby they offered to move us to a 'sister' hotel. As we left there was another disgruntled couple complaining so it seems there are problems. What was disappointing was that at no time did they apologise or accept responsibility. The new hotel (literally too), the Basilica, was more expensive but exactly what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DanItaly
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel located in the heart of the old town of Istanbul, just a few steps away from the most important monuments (Blue Mosque, Aghia Sophia, Gran Bazar etc... Great staff ready to help and give information. The rooms are comfortable - although a bit small, but very clean. Absolutely breathtaking view from the breakfast room. Breakfast is rich and various. I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul. Just a few steps away there is the cafÃ©-restaurant Amedros where they serve excellent food at moderate prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel with good locations and personal service”
Reviews.Author: farhanah
Reviews.Content: Right in the centre of Sultanahmet district, within walking distance to Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. In fact we had a beautiful view of these two hotels everyday at breakfast from the roof terrace of the hotel. Surrounded by trendy cafes, restaurant and in the same block as a McDonalds, if Turkish food is not your cup of tea. The rooms were beutiful, if a bit small, but of an acceptable size for a city hotel. Service was very personable and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “An Experience of a Lifetime, We Didn't Expect This Much!”
Reviews.Author: AshliezillaHirsch
Reviews.Content: When my father and I decided to journey to Istanbul for a quality time and a cultural experience, we were unaware of the friends we would make...the life long friends! We are already planning a return trip this summer out of the desire to reunite ourselves with our friends at the Rast as well as the people we had met outside of our staying quarters. There is never a dull moment at the Rast. I felt completely comfortable with every member of the staff, and they were always delighted to accommodate to mine and my father's needs. We were both blown away by the view from the breakfast terrace upstairs, and the food served every morning is INEXPLICABLY DELICIOUS. The Rast was more than just a hotel to us. We got to know the staff on a personal level and continue to stay in touch with them as individuals after our stay had come to an end. I became so close and friendly with the staff, that I was even given the opportunity to give and receive relative language lessons with some of my new friends from the staff. It was a delightful experience and we are undoubtedly returning. We have certainly convinced many of our friends back home to not only visit Istanbul, but to highly consider staying at the Rast. It is reasonably priced, luxurious, cozy, and a place where I, in all seriousness, felt at home. The location is incredible, as well. My father and I did not take any form of public transportation for the entire duration of our vacation. Everything was in walking distance, and members of the staff were incredible enough to take us to exclusive shopping districts on THEIR OWN TIME! They truly care about their guests and treat them with the utmost respect and consideration. Leaving the Rast was emotional, because in all honesty, we were leaving our friends, as well as the cultural capital of Europe. However, we will see the Rast again shortly! There is no other place or experience I would rather be a part of. Please take my review for all that it is worth, and plan to stay at the Rast during your trip to Istanbul. You will be extremely glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new hotel in prime central location”
Reviews.Author: EVOMuscat
Reviews.Content: Just been for a week, and this hotel is central to all the local sites, great view of the blue mosque from the roof top restaurant and a stones throw from great places to eat, shop and the tram. It is smack in the middle of the old city. Staff were excellent and could not do enough to help, from the reception, cleaners and the restaurant staff. Food basic but tasty, rooms comfortable and snug. Found them too hot in the winter and had to sleep with windows open. Toilet did smell once but nothing that a double flush did not sort out. You will have to go to the KOC museum, on the north shore, you need to get a taxi for 18TL but well worth it for a full day, even has a real world war 2 submarine you can tour. Excellent hotel and worth a try

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Suelee64
Reviews.Content: you can walk to Blue Mosque, The Grand Bazzar, etc. You are in the middle of the historic town and it is very easy to get around. We stayed in a Suite which was on the (top floor) 5th floor. The suite (which is one of the two suites in the hotel) has a large balcony with table & chairs which has a wonderful view of the Blue Mosque. The only problem is we were there for several nights and because of rain/wind we were unable to use the balcony. We put on raincoats and still went to all the sights we had on our list. I believe it cleared up as soon as we left. This is a small friendly hotel with a nice restaurant on the roof floor with perfect views. The staff at the desk and restaurant were very helpful, going out of their way to help us with anything we needed. This is what makes this hotel so great! You feel like family. The breakfast buffet was very good and had a nice selection. There was free internet in the lobby. You can walk just a few steps out the door to lounges, restaurants and shops, etc.

Reviews.Title: “very good location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: gregorylisa
Reviews.Content: I visited Istanbul in September for a business trip and my company had chosen this Hotel. I liked it when I saw the pictures. However, it was more than those pictures. First of all, it is located at the center of the Istanbul which was very important for us. Second, our rooms were cleaned everyday. Moreover, we could see Bosphorus and very beautiful mosques from the roof of the hotel. Last and may be one of the most important thing is foods were really delicious especially Turkish Kebabs. It was a very good and comfortable trip for me. And i can advise this Hotel anyone who wants to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return to Rast Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChristyBarcelona
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, new hotel in an excellent location. I really can not find much that I did not really like. The complementary airport pickup was wonderful (and we were three hours delayed so that pickup was at 1am!), the breakfast and view were spectacular, the staff was extremely friendly. The rooms were very nice and larger than I expected for a triple room. I would give them a 4.5/5, only because with a few extra touches, like a hairdryer where you don't have to constantly hold the button, or a bit bigger televsion (it was like a 18-20 inch) it would definitely be a 5. But you are not going to want to stay inside and watch TV anyway, and the hairdryer is not that big of deal. Stay in this hotel! You will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent and Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hammude
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Istanbul. I think we couldn't find a better one to live Istanbul. In the middle of the historical peninsula, very closed to every touristic center, we enjoyed a lot. Hotel choice is so important in a city like Istanbul where there is a lot to see and feel. Its location and kindness of hotel personnel were great. I am looking forward to next year for Istanbul. You don't want to miss the view of Bosphorus through the windows.

Reviews.Title: “thanks much Ä±sttanbul”
Reviews.Author: poulPorto
Reviews.Content: Ä± am poul from potugal.Ä± wonderded Ä±stanbul so much.last summer Ä± choosed Ä±stanbul for holÄ±day and Ä± searched a nÄ±ce hotel on Ä±nternet.Ä± have seen an advertÄ±sement about the hotel and Ä± booked a room.that was reaaly a wrÄ±ght choosen,baceuse hotel was so nÄ±ce and relaxable.espaceally the staf was wonderful.Ä± advÄ±se to everybody to stay Ä±n Rast hotel Ä±f you want to have a wonderful hotel Ä±n Ä±stanbul.thanks much for all satff and Ä±stanbul:)))))

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time spent at Rast Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: VickyLebanon
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I went to Turkey in November and we stayed at Rast hotel. We loved Istanbul and the people were wonderful !! The hotel was close to everywhere we wanted to go, it was great! At the hotel, the staff were very nice especially one of the employees, Yasser, he was extremely friendly and smiling all the time, and explained to us where we should go and where to visit.. We left the hotel having a new turkish friend ! As well, the view from the terrace was breathtaking in the morning. I will definitely go back to the same hotel on my next trip to turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LondonDana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rast Hotel for our 25th wedding anniversary and enjoyed it very much. The staff are excellent, friendly and efficient. The view from the breakfast room is fantastic, and the choice of food is great, something for everyone. The rooms are spotlessly clean and comfortable. It is also within easy reach of all the main attractions. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as it made our stay relaxing and enjoyable. Transport to and from airport is also a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff, made our visit memorable..”
Reviews.Author: lakecliff
Reviews.Content: From our airport pick-up to our cruise ship drop off by a great driver and staff member of the Rast, we felt like family at the hotel. The location is perfect for sight-seeing and we felt very safe everywhere we walked. Any thing we asked for was immediately addressed and delivered with a smile and great attitude. Rooms were clean and good size for a small European hotel and bath amenities were on a par of what we expect in America. I would definitely stay at the Rast again if I return to Istanbul, which I hope I can do one day for a longer visit. It is an amazing place and we only had a chance to touch the surface of that wonderful city. Ask for a high floor facing the Mosques for an amazing view. Or just go up to the 6th floor terrace and enjoy a panoramic view of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Niddy
Reviews.Content: I agree with the recent reviews posted, the hotel offers an extremely helpful and friendly service and is well situated for all the sites. If like me you are going to Istansul on a leisure break then this hotel is ideal; it is good value, clean and comfortable. Location is good for the Blue Mosque/Aya Sophia etc in one direction, and then also the Grand Bazaar and turkish baths in the other. Breakfast is an enjoyable experience due to the stunning views. Good restaurants are located nearby down the hill towards the Aya Sophia - I recommend Mozaik and Khorasani (www.khorasanirestaurant.com). Helpful tips:- Turkish bath - try and go in the day when it is quiet. Women are given knickers to wear and that is all people tend to wear, no need to take a swimsuit. The scary ladies in their bikinis tell you what to do so dont worry if you have to go in on your own! Arasta Bazaar - is a more pleasant shopping experience if you are looking for better quality goods than the Grand Bazaar. Handbags - amazing fakes, but make the decision before you go as to whether you are going to go for an expensive leather version (worth it) or a cheaper plastic version. Kucek Kose in the Grand Bazaar is good. Topkapi Palace - I personally think the extra payment for the Harem is a rip-off - dont bother you will see enough to keep you happy. You will get the living daylights harassed out of you by touts/vendors, but they mean well and can be highly amusing. It may get a bit wearing if you are women travelling on your own! but i always felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “great location for the Istanbul tourist”
Reviews.Author: bear35
Reviews.Content: The Rast Hotel is the perfect place for the solo or small group tourists who want to visit the great sights of istanbul. The historic sites are all within walking distance. abundant restaurants and the Metro are nearby. The hotel is staffed by friendly helpful people. The breakfast buffet on the sixth floor has a wonderful view of the mosques and the Bosporus. i would stay there again. My visit was entirely satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent, Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Kat735
Reviews.Content: We travel extensively and have never witten a review. But this time I had to. We stayed at the Rast Hotel in November. I would highly recommend this hotel, The room was excellent, and very clean. We had a beautiful view of the city from our terrace. The breakfast room/restaurant also had a fabulous view, actually, breathtaking. The hotel was extremely well located, we walked everywhere, and saw all the sites. Truly a hidden gem. The hotel staff was amazing, I can't remember all their names, and I am sorry, but Yo Yo and Happy Robert were wonderful. Don't hesitate book this hotel!!!! Laura and Mike from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a super location..very convenient”
Reviews.Author: IngridJacqueline
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Rast hotel for 4 night recently. The room was excellent and very clean. The view from breakfastroom on the topfloor was breathtaking..staff were extremely friendly and helpful. At reception the front office clerks Happy and Yasar were also very helpful and kind and always happy to recommend good places to eat and trying to make our stay as pleasant as possible. The location of this hotel was very good..close to all the main sites and it was easy that the tram was so close by. We prefer this area any time to Taksim area. If we ever go back to Istanbul..we would stay at the Rast hotel. xx Ingrid and Jacqueline

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for the main historic sites, friendly, helpful and polite staff.”
Reviews.Author: worker15
Reviews.Content: For a visit to Istanbul to see the main historic sites then this hotel is excellent for its location and its friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “In one word: wow!”
Reviews.Author: Maarten62
Reviews.Content: Great location and superb staff - special thanks to Mr Yasar Ã–zpay at the front desk for his service with a smile. The view from the hotel's roof terrace is simply incredible. Our room wasn't huge but spotless: the hotel was surprisingly quiet given its very central location at a 10-minute walk from the Aya Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar and all other sites.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating in more ways than one”
Reviews.Author: RDnED
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rast Hotel at the end of our holiday in Turkey. Tarik PAKSOY the sales manager was excellent - he resolved a problem for us that could have created a huge inconvenience without any expectations at all. The hotel is in a great location in the centre of the Sultanahmet area, handy to the trams and major sights. We would recommend the Rast Hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “EVERYTHING BETTER.”
Reviews.Author: etnofear
Reviews.Content: My business trip so I stayed at the hotel found. returned to service and quality, against my gaping at. recommend to everyone. terrace was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “really satisfied”
Reviews.Author: bobkurt86
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience for me,I found Rast Hotel from tripadvisor, and I think it really deserves good reviews. Hotel placed in excellent location, and the view of restaurant was incredible. Taste of dishes were delicious.Everything was new and clean beds,baths..etc Also front desk service was really good, they were so helpful. I totally suggest you to stay there if you are looking for a nice,safe and clean hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly but slightly confused service”
Reviews.Author: themajortraveler
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here for three consecutive nights, then went on to Israel. We returned here for one more night before coming back to the U.S. They are very friendly and eager to help you--evidenced by their trying to sell us tours and thrusting brochures in our hands before completing check-in. However, they were confused at times and it seemed as if they were struggling with handling more than one task at a time. The room was very small each stay, and the bathroom, while efficient, was almost uncomfortably cramped. However, it was very clean. The free wi-fi, when it worked, did not have a strong enough signal for Skype. Their breakfast room and terrace has a stunning view of the Sultanahmet area, including the Aya Sofya, the Blue Dome and the Sea of Marmara. The food was tasty, plentiful, and the young woman who maintained the room was very warm and friendly. We arrived at different times from one another into Ataturk Airport and had arranged for their car to pick up each of us--one was free, the other was 25 Euros. A cab costs about the same, maybe a bit less. There is great confusion at the airport when you exit customs and immigration, with dozens of drivers holding signs, so it's a bit stressful to find Rast's driver. It would be helpful if they had a better form of identification or signage. After seeing the sights in the Sulatnahmet district, there's no compelling reason to stay there (besides the beautiful view), so I would likely choose another area of town with more lively evening action. But the Rast Hotel is charming and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, warm and kindly small hotel on a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dragonflyNetherlands
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in the Rast hotel. Very kindly service oriented staff, doing their very best to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Service with a smile, from the desk clerc to the cleaning lady. Spacy and clean room (but we had the room for 3 persons) which was sound proof so we slept well. Marvelous view from the deck terras where you can enjoy the comprehensive breakfast. The hotel is perfectly located near to the top attractions and the tram. Small tips for the hotel: a coffee/thee maker and maybe in the future wireless internet in the rooms?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great location, clean & friendly”
Reviews.Author: LecturerLongIsland
Reviews.Content: The hotel opened this past May, so everything is new and spotless. Everything is light sensored, including access to room which is controlled by your room card. The elevator has a slide presentation on a side panel and the daily temperature. As we had arranged, my husband and I were picked up at our ship's dock and driven to the hotel. (Only a 5 minute wait) Our driver Sardak was wonderful. He was the same driver who took us to the airport and made sure he was there 15 minutes ahead of schedule. Given our four night stay, both transports were free. Since the hotel was full the first night, it had been arranged prior to our travel that we would stay that night at the Golden Horn. (Only a few blocks away) It was nice to have two hotels to compare!. Despite the fact that the Golden Horn had a fabulous breakfact, as compared to the mediocre one at the Rast, I'd pick the Rast any day. Our room, 403, was spacious, had a desk and chair, a small terrace (about 2 feet by 4 feet) and a bathtub. (Some rooms have just showers and there seems to be various configurations per room) The bathtub is high and one had to be careful navigating in and out. The beds, while not the softest, were a far sight better than many I have stayed in and definitely softer than the ramrod hard bed at the Golden Horn. The front desk staff was wonderful and all too eager to help. One night, we went to see the Whirling Dervish show and asked for directions. Next thing you knew, they drove us there, for free. Tarik and Happy were happy to supply information and advice. While the staff may not be up to speed on the computer, I was grateful there was one available and there for customer use. (Some hotels charge) Again, if it weren't for their help, we would have had difficulty. While I wasn't thrilled by the wait-staff that serviced the beautiful terrace, which had both indoor and outdoor service, I would put that aside in favor of the overall picture. One got the impression that they are trying. It's not the Four Seasons Hotel (which by the way has a FANTASTIC Sunday brunch) but then again you are not paying Four Seasons prices. Yes, the price is high for the value one gets, but you are in a spotless hotel, in a safe area with a staff that makes it an effort to get to know you. Bottom Line- Would we stay there again - Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views of Istanbul with your breakfast at the Rast Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Tentontuna
Reviews.Content: We found the Rast Hotel on the Internet, through Trip Advisor, and were more than happy with the results. The hotel is in a convenient location in the old part of town (ten minutes walk from the Blue Mosque). It is new, the rooms are spacious and clean, good beds, excellent but small new bathroom (our shower had a window that allowed us to see the Blue Mosque while bathing!!!). Most suprising was the lovely terrace off our room, with table, two chairs, umbrella, and fantastic views of the Blue Mosque, the Aya Sofia mosque, and the Bosporus beyond. I kept waking up at night to look out our full length window/doors onto the terrace and the floodlit Blue Mosque beyond. A sight I will never forget. The full breakfast in the morning, on the rooftop dining room with 180 degree views of Istanbul and the mosques, Bosporus, Sea of Marmara, etc. was a special treat. The food was excellent, and the views fantastic. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. For the price, it was a great value. Be sure to ask for Room 502!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations...”
Reviews.Author: IrishWife1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a one-night stay at the Rast in Istanbul. We were curious about the hotel since itâ€™s been getting such rave reviews here. In our opinion, it doesnâ€™t live up to the hype. The hotel provides a driver who greeted us at the airport at 5:45 a.m. He was professional and pointed out several interesting sites along the drive to Istanbul. Upon our arrival at the Rast, we were warmly welcomed by the desk clerk who advised us that accommodation was available for our early check-in. While we waited for the keys, he gave us suggestions and brochures to help us make the most of our limited time in Istanbul. We were shown to a spacious third floor room with three small single beds separated by nightstands. When we booked, we were made aware that no double rooms were available. The modern but small bathroom housed a shower, attractively arranged toiletries, a hairdryer and slippers. Additional amenities included a safe, a mini-bar containing water and soft drinks and a balcony that overlooked the street at the front of the hotel. The room could have done with better lighting as there is no overhead light fixture and the lamps cast a dull glow. There was a bit of a noise problem late at night that was easily remedied by closing the balcony doors and turning on the air conditioner. Both the air conditioner and open doors helped to dispel a musty odor in the room. There is a lovely wide stairway leading to each floor; unfortunately it is not well lit. Motion detectors that donâ€™t always do the job and sometimes left us in total darkness control the lighting. Since there is only one elevator in this six-storey hotel for both staff and guests, sometimes using the stairs was the only option. Breakfast was adequate. Choices included various fruits and vegetables, cakes, bread, two hot dishes, coffee and juice. The coffee was strong and flavorful; the juice was watery. The view from the rooftop restaurant was spectacular and encompassed the Blue Mosque and Hague Sofia. The location of the Rast Hotel is perfectly situated; it is a two minute walk to the restaurant/cafÃ© area, less than 10 minutes to the Hague Sofia and the Blue Mosque, and the about the same for the Grand Bazaar. We thought the Rast Hotel was an ordinary, adequate 4* hotel. We give top marks to the driver and to the young man who was on duty when we arrived. The rest of the staff was perfunctory at best. We look forward to other options next time weâ€™re in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Three-and-a-half stars”
Reviews.Author: lazytravelling
Reviews.Content: I really want to give this hotel 4 stars -- for its excellent location, efficient front desk service and magnificent rooftop restaurant... but I can't. We booked this hotel based on the reviews here on tripadvisor. The hotel only just opened a few months ago so the furniture is new, the carpets are clean, etc. Still, neither the furnishings nor the room service live up to the rave reviews. A short list of the things we found lacking: unreliable cleaning service (towels one day, NO towels the next!), soap dish removed from the room on our 2nd day (?), no garbage can in the main room, extremely tiny bathroom with no electrical outlets, spotty wifi service, very hard bed -- like sleeping on a block of wood -- with no blanket, just a sheet and that bed cover thing that people always toss on the floor. Two other things: -- We returned to our room one day to find that it stank of sewage. It was a bit of a mystery because the smell was not coming from the bathroom, from the AC vent or from the outside. It disappeared after a couple hours, and we still don't know what it was. -- Our room was on the 5th floor, the hotel restaurant is on the 6th floor. Breakfast service is incredibly loud -- chairs being pulled out, pushed back in, the sound of cutlery, people moving about. The view from the 5th floor is great, but I would not recommend it because of the noise. We did like the restaurant and the restaurant staff is very nice. The view from the roof is breathtaking and the location of the hotel is ideal for visiting all the big sites: Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, etc. Despite these great advantages, the hotel does not live up to all of the hype. I recommend it -- with reservations. Still, the next time we go to Istanbul -- I think we'll be staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is beautiful and quiet and all the staff helpful, friendly”
Reviews.Author: alwfyah
Reviews.Content: Close to transportation, services, restaurants and a wonderful view of the old mosques in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Excellent exprerience, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: AthenaGreece
Reviews.Content: IDEAL location for a trip to Istanbul. Stayed 4 nights, everything to visit was around by foot. Very willing staff, responded to all our demands, nice rooms, nicely decorated, attention to any detail, cleaned every day. Safe place to come back at night too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with stunning views & excellent levels of service”
Reviews.Author: ShinobiNorthampton
Reviews.Content: We selected this particluar hotel mainly due to the excellent past reviews on many websites including trip advisor. It certainly lived up to its reputation! We opted for the suite room for its views of the Blue Mosque & Aya Sophia. We were simply blown away with the view upon arrival, which is certainly the defining feature of the suite room. The hotel could not be situated in a better location, being 5 minutes walk from the Sultanahmet square. Restaurants, take-aways, local transport, shops & bazaars were just around the corner. Service was very friendly & a baby cot was provided upon arrival. The rooms do not include tea/coffee making facilities including a kettle. Having said that the hotel was more than happy to provide boiling water not only for tea/coffee but also for baby milk. On the negative side, the lack of iron in the rooms was a little incovenient & the bathroom had a 'sewer' type smell especially at night. Also being on gthe 5th floor, the wifi internet access was somewhat erratic. However, this would not put us off revisiting this hotel when we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but ...”
Reviews.Author: Turki_Saad
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is amazing, but i am quite conservative against its staff, yet they are friendly but i found of them marketing for daily tours with rates that is higher than any other agency. furthermore, the Taxis which are called by them are having higher rate than other taxis, they are taking a commssion i guess. The rooms were very clean and recently refurbished, yet lacking some stuff like coffee machine, tissue box, trash can etc. The toilette is very tight and the sink of the shower was so small and the water was flooding everytime i take my shower.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Alexander2009_9
Reviews.Content: Rast hotel is a little jewel tacked among Istanbulâ€™s famous attractions: Ayasofya, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Archeology Museum, Yerebatan Cistern, Hippodrome, Grand Bazaar, while many more can be easily reached by taxi or public transportation; one cannot ask for a better location. To top this up, a sumptuous breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace that has an amazing view of some of the above mentioned sites, the Bosphorus straight and its famous bridge, and the Asian side of the city. We arrived early at the hotel, and while the room was being prepared for us, we were invited to relax and enjoy a complimentary Turkish coffee on the terrace - UNFORGETABLE! The level of professionalism of all, staff and management, combined with a genuine hospitability, made our 5- day stay at the hotel a memorable experience. Everybody was very helpful, trying hard to make our vacation as enjoyable as possible. Thank you, thank you, and thank you! The hotel is stylishly decorated and kept very clean; our room was elegant, spacious, and quiet. We highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely come back. Adrian & Monica Canada

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views & location but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: DevonianBusinessman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rast hotel on business after reading the positive reviews on trip advisor. A cab from "Ataturk" airport will cost you around â‚¬ 20-25 (40-50 Turkish Lira) and I prebooked a taxi through the hotel as I arrived on the late flight from London. The cab was waiting for me, however I had to pay with cash rather than be able to add the amount to my hotel bill which was slightly annoying. The hotel is ideally situated around 5-10 minutes walk to Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque in the old town. The Breakfast terrace on the top floor is spectacular! This is one of the best views I've ever enjoyed over breakfast and is the major reason to stay at this hotel. The buffet breakfast is ample and enjoyable although the hot food options are rather limited. The terrace would make a great bar, however it is deserted after the evening meals finish at 22.00, which is a pity. My room was nice and clean however the bathroom was tiny. Although cleverly planned, the bathroom was not really large enough for the double room that I had. Everything else was clean though and the mini-bar and safe were useful features. The one major negative I had though is that I did not sleep well on either night due to street and room noise. I could hear one room guest clearly shouting about a football match next door and then him returning back later at 3.30am. Car horns were also going off every so often which was not conducive to a good night's sleep. All in all this is a really nice hotel though and the roof terrace and location are really excellent with all the staff also being very helpful and courteous. The noise from the street and adjoining rooms though is something to bear in mind if you have an early morning start the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Million dollar View!”
Reviews.Author: JNTC
Reviews.Content: At the time of our stay, the hotel opened only 3 mos prior. So everything was still new. Can't say enough good things about this hotel except that if you plan to visit Istanbul, I can't think of a better hotel to stay in. Tops even the Ritz. The front desk manager [day shift] even took the time to plan out our entire 4 day stay and offered tips on which sites to see first. - Located in the Old City district [which is where all the main attractions are] - It's off the main road which is perfect 'cus it offers both peace & quiet and also easy access to all the sites. - Walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Underground Cistern & Topkapi Palace. - 10 min. tram ride to Spice Market & Grand Bazaar - Rooftop cafe at the hotel offers a million dollar view from its terrace: Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia & the Bosphorus Bridge which links 2 continents [Europe & Asia]. - Breakfast included - Free internet access from hotel lobby [2 stations available for use] - Entire hotel staff was extremely friendly. - Try to have the hotel arrange your taxi services to avoid being ripped off. Drivers arranged by the hotel will not overcharge you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frznn81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Rast Hotel 4 nights. Location is perfect, room's large and clean, breakfast was good. Staff people were kindly, but not always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: zolla
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, both for location and for quality/price ratio. Silent rooms, excellent breakfast. The terrace offer a magnificent view all over Sultanamhet and Bosphorus

HotelInfo.Name: Rast Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Binbirdirek Mh. Klodferar Cd. No:4 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
